section.para: The following table shows the ports that are used in the Eduras project. Currently the Meta Server is considered to run on illonis.dyndns.org:9877.

row.entry: If the client application is started without a parameter, it will use a random free port. If given, the client will bind TCP and UDP sockets to the first parameter (if it's a valid port number). This is the port we recommend to use then.
The server's TCP and UDP sockets are bound to this port if not specified differently.
This is the port the Eduras Server on illonis.dyndns.org runs on.
This is the port on which each Eduras Server listens for discovery messages.
This is the port on which each Eduras Clients listens for answers to previously sent discovery messages.
The Meta Server listens on this port for TCP connections and requests.
